DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Mindful movement self-directed activity mindfulness ( intention , attention , attitude ) physical movement . A mindful movement program may effective improve well-being old woman breast cancer survivor . PURPOSE : This randomized clinical trial study well mindful movement program work improve quality life old female breast cancer survivor .
DOC.brief_title: Mindful Movement Program Improving Quality Life Older Female Breast Cancer Survivors
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - To test effect 12-week Mindful Movement Program quality life old female breast cancer survivor . - To test effect program mindfulness outcomes participant . - To compare mindfulness quality experimental group control group . - To determine qualitative benefit program describe participant . OUTLINE : Participants randomize 1 2 intervention arm . - Arm I ( Mindful Movement Program [ MMP ] ) : Participants undergo 2-hour MMP session weekly 12 week . Participants encourage practice intentional-mindful movement home 5 minute daily week 1-4 , 10 minute daily week 5-8 , 15 minute daily week 9-12 . Mindful movement self-directed activity incorporate mindfulness concept physical movement . Mindfulness consist three core element : intention ( reason participate mindfulness intervention ) , attention ( observe experience present moment ) , attitude ( nonjudgmental openness acceptance experience ) . Each MMP session include verbal share partner group movement individually partner , focus element mindfulness . Music incorporated portion session . - Arm II ( control ) : Participants undergo intervention . All participant complete questionnaire sociodemographic individual characteristic , quality life ( include psychological , social , spiritual , physical well-being , anxiety depression , fear recurrence , body image , upper body symptom ) , movement , mindfulness ( include attention , self-compassion , intention ) baseline week 12 18 . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 75 participant ( 45 experimental group 30 control group ) accrue study .
